intro: Seseli junceum, commonly known as slender seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Seseli junceum is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
